```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
library(readxl)
debt <- read_excel("Makroøkonomisk projekt.xlsx", sheet = "Debt ")
na.omit(debt)
debt
```

```{r}
date01 <- debt$Date...2
netlending <- debt$`Percent of GDP...3`
ggplot(debt, aes(x = date01, y = netlending)) +
  geom_line(color = "blue") +
  labs(title = "Generel offentlig udlån/låntagning for Tyskland (netto)",
       x = "År",
       y = "Procent af BNP") +
  theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) + 
  geom_abline(aes(intercept=0, slope=0))
```

```{r}
date02 <- debt$Date...8
grossdebt <- debt$`Percent of GDP...9`
ggplot(debt, aes(x = date02, y = grossdebt)) +
  geom_line(color = "blue") +
  labs(title = "Generel offentlig gæld (total)",
       x = "År",
       y = "Procent af BNP") +
  theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
```

```{r}
date1 <- debt$Date...5
projectionbudget1 <- debt$`Percent of GDP...6`
date2 <- debt$Date...11
projection2 <- debt$`Percent of GDP...12`
plot(date1, projectionbudget1, type = "l", main = "Projection for net lending/borrowing", ylab = "Percent of GDP", xlab = "Årstal", col="red")
grid()
plot(date2, projection2, type = "l", main = "Projection of government gross debt for Germany ", ylab = "Percent of GDP", xlab = "Årstal", col="red")
grid()
```
